intro: Acer vanvolxemii, commonly known as the Vanuxem maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its ornamental, palmately lobed leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in autumn. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and has a rounded, symmetrical crown. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, appearing in clusters before the leaves emerge in spring. The bark is smooth and greyish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
